info.title: Azure Load Testing
info.description:
These APIs allow end users to create, view and run load tests using Azure Load
Test Service.

Oauth2.description: The Azure Active Directory OAuth2 Flow

get.summary: Get test run file by file name.
get.description: Get test run file by file name.

value.description: The TestRun items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.summary: Get test run details by name.
get.description: Get test run details by name.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: Unique test run name as identifier

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

patch.summary: Create and start a new test run with the given name.
patch.description: Create and start a new test run with the given name.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description:
Unique name for the load test run, must contain only lower-case alphabetic,
numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

parameters.name: oldTestRunId
parameters.description:
Existing test run identifier that should be rerun, if this is provided, the
test will run with the JMX file, configuration and app components from the
existing test run. You can override the configuration values for new test run
in the request body.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Load test run model

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result.

x-ms-error-code.description: The error code for specific error that occurred.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

Unique name for the load test run, must contain only lower-case alphabetic,
numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

parameters.name: aggregation
parameters.description: The aggregation

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The interval (i.e. timegrain) of the query.

values.name: PT5S
values.description: 5 seconds, available only if test run duration is less than 10 minutes

values.name: PT10S
values.description: 10 seconds, available only if test run duration is less than 10 minutes

values.name: PT5M
values.description: 5 minutes, available only if test run duration is greater than 1 minute

values.name: PT1H
values.description: 1 hour, available only if test run duration is greater than 1 minute

parameters.name: metricName
parameters.description: Metric name

parameters.name: metricNamespace
parameters.description: Metric namespace to query metric definitions for.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan of the query. It is a string with the following format 'startDateTime_ISO/endDateTime_ISO'.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Metric dimension filter

put.summary:
Upload input file for a given test name. File size can't be more than 50 MB.
Existing file with same name for the given test will be overwritten. File
should be provided in the request body as application/octet-stream.
put.description:
Upload input file for a given test name. File size can't be more than 50 MB.
Existing file with same name for the given test will be overwritten. File
should be provided in the request body as application/octet-stream.

parameters.name: testId
parameters.description:
Unique name for the load test, must contain only lower-case alphabetic,
numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: Unique name for test file with file extension like : App.jmx

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: File type

values.name: ADDITIONAL_ARTIFACTS
values.description: If file is not any of other supported type.

values.name: ZIPPED_ARTIFACTS
values.description: If the file is a compressed archive containing a collection of various artifacts or resources.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The file content as application/octet-stream.

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result.

x-ms-error-code.description: The error code for specific error that occurred.

values.name: v2022_11_01
values.description: The 2022-11-01 version of the Azure Load Testing API.

values.description: The 2023-04-01-preview version of the Azure Load Testing API.

values.name: None
values.description: Aggregation will be average in this case

AppComponent.description:
An Azure resource object (Refer azure generic resource model :
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/resources/resources/get-by-id#genericresource)

resourceName.description: Azure resource name, required while creating the app component.

resourceType.description: Azure resource type, required while creating the app component.

resourceGroup.description: Resource group name of the Azure resource

subscriptionId.description: Subscription Id of the Azure resource

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

value.description: The value of the certificate for respective type

values.name: AKV_CERT_URI
values.description: If the certificate is stored in an Azure Key Vault

DimensionFilter.description: Dimension name and values to filter

values.description: The dimension values. Maximum values can be 20.

nextLink.description: Link for the next set of values in case of paginated results, if applicable

ErrorDetails.description: Error details if there is any failure in load test run

message.description: Error details in case test run was not successfully run.

ErrorResponseBody.description: The definition of an error object.

expireDateTime.description: Expiry time of the file (ISO 8601 literal format)

values.name: ADDITIONAL_ARTIFACTS
values.description: If file is not any of other supported type.

values.name: ZIPPED_ARTIFACTS
values.description: If the file is a compressed archive containing a collection of various artifacts or resources.

values.name: PT5S
values.description: 5 seconds, available only if test run duration is less than 10 minutes

values.name: PT10S
values.description: 10 seconds, available only if test run duration is less than 10 minutes

values.name: PT5M
values.description: 5 minutes, available only if test run duration is greater than 1 minute

values.name: PT1H
values.description: 1 hour, available only if test run duration is greater than 1 minute

engineInstances.description:
The number of engine instances to execute load test. Supported values are in
range of 1-45. Required for creating a new test.

splitAllCSVs.description:
If false, Azure Load Testing copies and processes your input files unmodified
across all test engine instances. If true, Azure Load Testing splits the CSV
input data evenly across all engine instances. If you provide multiple CSV
files, each file will be split evenly.

quickStartTest.description:
If true, optionalLoadTestConfig is required and JMX script for the load test is
not required to upload.

MetricAvailability.description: Metric availability specifies the time grain (aggregation interval or frequency)

timeGrain.description:
The time grain specifies the aggregation interval for the metric. Expressed as
a duration 'PT1M', 'PT1H', etc.

namespace.description: The namespace the metric belongs to.

primaryAggregationType.description: The primary aggregation type value defining how to use the values for display.

supportedAggregationTypes.description: The collection of what all aggregation types are supported.

metricAvailabilities.description:
Metric availability specifies the time grain (aggregation interval or
frequency).

value.description: the values for the metric definitions.

MetricNamespace.description: Metric namespace class specifies the metadata for a metric namespace.

value.description: The values for the metric namespaces.

MetricRequestPayload.description: Filters to fetch the set of metric

filters.description:
Get metrics for specific dimension values. Example: Metric contains dimension
like SamplerName, Error. To retrieve all the time series data where SamplerName
is equals to HTTPRequest1 or HTTPRequest2, the DimensionFilter value will be
{"SamplerName", ["HTTPRequest1", "HTTPRequest2"}

timestamp.description: The timestamp for the metric value in ISO 8601 format.

Metrics.description: The response to a metrics query.

value.description: The TimeSeriesElement items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

Oauth2.description: The Azure Active Directory OAuth2 Flow

endpointUrl.description: Test URL. Provide the complete HTTP URL. For example, http://contoso-app.azurewebsites.net/login

maxResponseTime.description: Maximum response time of the API/endpoint

PFAction.description: Action to take on failure of pass/fail criteria.

values.name: continue
values.description: Test will continue to run even if pass fail metric criteria metric gets failed

values.name: stop
values.description: Test run will stop if pass fail criteria metric is not passed.

values.name: percentage
values.description: Criteria applies for given percentage value

values.name: response_time_ms
values.description: Pass fail criteria for response time metric

values.name: latency
values.description: Pass fail criteria for response time metric

values.name: error
values.description: Pass fail criteria for error metric

values.name: requests
values.description: Pass fail criteria for total requests

values.name: requests_per_sec
values.description: Pass fail criteria for request rate.

values.name: passed
values.description: Given pass fail criteria metric has passed.

values.name: undetermined
values.description: Given pass fail criteria metric couldn't determine.

values.name: failed
values.description: Given pass fail criteria metric has failed.

PFTestResult.description: Test result based on pass/fail criteria.

PassFailCriteria.description: Pass fail criteria for a test.

passFailMetrics.description: Map of id and pass fail metrics { id  : pass fail metrics }.

clientMetric.description: The client metric on which the criteria should be applied.

aggregate.description:
The aggregation function to be applied on the client metric. Allowed functions
- percentage - for error metric , avg, p50, p90, p95, p99, min,
max - for response_time_ms and latency metric, avg - for requests_per_sec,
count - for requests

requestName.description: Request name for which the Pass fail criteria has to be applied

value.description:
The value to compare with the client metric. Allowed values - error : [0.0 ,
100.0] unit- % , response_time_ms and latency : any integer value unit- ms.

action.description: Action taken after the threshold is met. Default is continue.

actualValue.description: The actual value of the client metric for the test run.

ResourceMetric.description:
Associated metric definition for particular metrics of the azure resource (
Refer :
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/monitor/metric-definitions/list#metricdefinition).

name.description: The invariant value of metric name

value.description: The value of the secret for the respective type

values.name: AKV_SECRET_URI
values.description: If the secret is stored in an Azure Key Vault

values.name: SECRET_VALUE
values.description: If the Plain text secret value provided

values.name: NOTSTARTED
values.description: Test run is not yet started.

values.name: CANCELLING
values.description: Test run request is getting cancelled

values.name: VALIDATION_SUCCESS
values.description: Test run JMX file is validated

values.name: VALIDATION_FAILURE
values.description: Test run JMX file validation is failed

passFailCriteria.description: Pass fail criteria for a test.

secrets.description:
Secrets can be stored in an Azure Key Vault or any other secret store. If the
secret is stored in an Azure Key Vault, the value should be the secret
identifier and the type should be AKV_SECRET_URI. If the secret is stored
elsewhere, the secret value should be provided directly and the type should be
SECRET_VALUE.

environmentVariables.description: Environment variables which are defined as a set of <name,value> pairs.

inputArtifacts.description: The input artifacts for the test.

subnetId.description: Subnet ID on which the load test instances should run.

keyvaultReferenceIdentityType.description: Type of the managed identity referencing the Key vault.

keyvaultReferenceIdentityId.description: Resource Id of the managed identity referencing the Key vault.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The last Modified datetime(ISO 8601 literal format).
The last Modified datetime(ISO 8601 literal format).

additionalFileInfo.description: Additional supported files for the test run

testRunId.description: Unique test run name as identifier

testResult.description: Test result for pass/Fail criteria used during the test run.

virtualUsers.description: Number of virtual users, for which test has been run.

startDateTime.description: The test run start DateTime(ISO 8601 literal format).

endDateTime.description: The test run end DateTime(ISO 8601 literal format).

subnetId.description: Subnet ID on which the load test instances should run.
